antichess
Class ControllerMaster

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.ClassLoader
      antichess.ControllerMaster

public class ControllerMaster
extends ClassLoader

The ControllerMaster is the highest level of the controller. It handles loading, saving and starting new games. It also handles telling the other parts of the controller what to do for the situation. Telling the Controller pause is handled through the ControllerMaster.

The ControllerMaster also extends ClassLoader so it can be used for loading resources.

The format needed for a Chess descriptor as input for startNewGame and load for a GameDescriptor des: des.getPlayers().size() == 2 des.getPlayers().get(0).equals(Player.WHITE) //checks for order des.getPlayers().get(1).equals(Player.BLACK)

Author:
nlharr
Specification Fields
  • currentGame //String describing the current game
  • currentBoard //the Board that the current game is running on
  • currentClock //the clock for the currentgame
  • currentUI //the UI that is currently active
  • description //GameDescriptor containing information about the type of game and the playes in the game
  • state //the states of the currentController

createControllerMaster

public static ControllerMaster createControllerMaster()
Returns:
a new ControllerMaster;

createTextUI

public void createTextUI(boolean allowShowBoard)
This function initializes a TextUI and starts the TextUI on its input loop. allowShowBoard specifies whether the ShowBoard command is available

Effects:
currentUI = a TextUI
Modifies:
currentUI

save

public void save(File writeFile)
          throws IOException
Saves the current game to the the file specified by writeFile. if currentGame is "Chess", save does nothing If currentGame is "Antichess" or "TextAntichess": Files are saved in the format specified by: http://www.mit.edu/~6.170/assignments/antichess/antichess.xsd If one of the players are untimed it saves the it as if both the players are untimed.

Throws:
IOException

load

public void load(File readFile,
                 GameDescriptor descriptor)
          throws IOException,
                 InvalidGameFileException,
                 IllegalArgumentException
Stops the current game and loads a game specified by fileName If currentGame is "Antichess" or "TextAntichess": If readFile does fit the format specified by: http://www.mit.edu/~6.170/assignments/antichess/antichess.xsd it loads the file. The type of the players (human or ai) is determined by descriptor.

Throws:
InvalidGameFileException - if the readFile does not fit the format IllegalArgumentException if the descriptor does not fit the format for a chessDescriptor IOException if the file does not fit the specified format For TextAntichess the player types (human or AI) for the new game on the player types of the players previous game. If there was no previous game then they are both human controlled. For Antichess the player types are specified in the descriptor. If currentGame is "Chess" the game as an Antichess game and the above rules apply
IOException
IllegalArgumentException
Requires:
descriptor fit the format for a ChessDescriptor
Effects:
currentBoard and currentClock are loaded from the file state the state is set to running
Modifies:
currentBoard, currentClock, state

startNewGame

public void startNewGame(GameDescriptor newGame)
Starts a new game based of the format specified in GameDescriptor

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the GameDescriptor newGame does not fit the format for a ChessGame and newGame.getGameTypeName() is "Chess", "Antichess", or "TextAntichess"
Effects:
if newGame describes a proper game currentGame = newGame.getGameTypeName() currentClock = clock specified by timing parameters of newGame currentUI = the UI specified by newGame.getGameTypeName() description = newGame
Modifies:
currentGame, currentBoard, currentClock, currentUI description, state

Pauses the current game

calls state.pauseGame()

Unpauses the current game

calls state.unpauseGame()
